column4: hi, i am on 10.04,sometime back I posted about the problem about sound output both ways(speaker and headphone)  even after i plug in the headphones. After taking some help from here it got fixed. But after restarting the machine the problem still exist? Any help appreciated!

hi, i am on 10.04,sometime back I posted about the problem about sound output both ways(speaker and headphone)  even after i plug in the headphones. After taking some help from here it got fixed. But after restarting the machine the problem still exist? Any help appreciated! How to go fix this?
system, preferences, sound then choose output tab, then at the bottom choose connector analog output
there is only this radio button -- internal-analog-audio-stereo
beneath that it says connector, drop down box choose analog output
open terminal type alsamixer and check if the channels are muted
do the channels say MM at the bottom?
when did the sound stop working?
ya it was there. The problem is that after putting headphones the sound also comes from the laptop speaker
in addition to the headphone output
ah ok and if you mute the laptops speakers what happens?
i think i have disturbed the alsamixer settings, what are recommended/default values?
